examples.sentence: Add just a dab of chili oil to the wonton soup.
Her makeup requires only a dab of foundation.
He gave the crying baby gentle dabs with a tissue.
The painter finished with light dabs of the brush.
We caught three dabs during our fishing trip.
Dab is often served grilled with lemon in coastal towns.
She's a dab at making dumplings with perfect pleats.
The old carpenter is a dab with traditional joinery.
Dab your face dry instead of rubbing after washing.
The artist dabbed paint onto the canvas with quick motions.
She dabbed at her eyes with a silk handkerchief.
Dab the stain gently with club soda before washing.
My grandma is a dab hand at making mooncakes.
Dab on some tiger balm for mosquito bites.
Kids were dabbling in the fountain like happy ducklings.
She dabbled her toes in the hotel pool while scrolling TikTok.
The panda kept dabbling at the bamboo shoots with its paws.
He absently dabbles with his chopsticks during video meetings.
This influencer dabbles in oil painting between livestreams.
Many programmers dabble in stand-up comedy nowadays.
A Didi driver dabble my new sneakers while washing his car.
The boiling hotpot dabble the table with chili oil.
CEOs who dabble in rap always go viral.
The ducklings were happy dabblers in the park pond.
As a dabbler in the fountain, the toddler giggled with water splashing around.
He's not a professional painter, just a dabbler in watercolors.
Most language dabblers quit before reaching intermediate level.
As a dabbler in philosophy, she enjoys reading Nietzsche during coffee breaks.
The silver dace shimmered like coins in the stream.
Grandpa's fishing tales always featured a giant dace.
Putin grows tomatoes at his dacha near Moscow.
The oligarch's dacha has a golden toilet shaped like a matryoshka doll.
Russian writers often finish novels at their summer dachas.
The dachshund squeezed through the fence like a sausage slipping out of a bun.
My dachshund's Instagram has more followers than mine.
Her miniature dachshund fits perfectly in a takeout food box.

examples.sentence: My dad can fix anything except my broken heart.
The dad secretly ate the kid's Halloween candy.
In ancient poems, 'dad' was often written as çˆ¹çˆ¹ with deep affection.
The toddler keeps shouting 'dad dad' while chasing the dog.
More Chinese men are becoming stay-at-home dads.
The toddler kept shouting 'dada!' while holding a durian.
Her first word was dada, which made her father cry like winning lottery.
This dada collage uses mahjong tiles and instant noodle packages.
The museum displayed a dada urinal next to Emperor Qianlong's vase.
The dada movement was crazier than livestream selling strange items.
The toddler shouted 'Daddy! Look at my dinosaur drawing!' while waving crayons.
She still calls her father 'Daddy' at 25 years old.
That luxury bag was definitely a gift from her sugar daddy.
The term 'sugar daddy' became trending after that viral Douyin video.
The Victorian-style dining room features walnut dados with gold leaf patterns.
Children's fingerprints covered the lower third of the dado in the kindergarten.
The marble dado supporting the ancient Buddha statue bears Sanskrit inscriptions.
Museum lighting highlighted the jade artifacts on their glass dados.
The print spooler daemon keeps running even when you're asleep.
This malware disguises itself as a system daemon to avoid detection.
MacOS uses launchd as its master launch daemon.
The daffodils by West Lake ripple like golden waves in spring breeze.
She received a pot of daffodils with a note saying 'You're brighter than spring'.
Her daffodil scarf matched perfectly with the cherry blossoms.
The designer used daffodil accents in this year's spring collection.
Taxi drivers protested when the city changed vehicles from daffodil yellow to silver.
The daffy duck kept trying to high-five its own reflection.
His daffy suggestion to solve traffic jams was to teach cars to fly.
After three espresso shots, she started doing daffy dance moves in the office.
The daffy professor wore mismatched socks to the Nobel Prize ceremony.
The AI went daffy after processing too many cat videos.
The daft penguin kept trying to fly by flapping its flippers.
It was daft of me to microwave aluminum foil for 'science experiment'.
The daft inventor created a self-walking sofa that chased cats.
She's gone completely daft after binge-watching 50 episodes of soap operas.
The daft celebration involved throwing cabbages at the mayor's car.
Their daft hen party ended up in a karaoke battle with pensioners.
The AI kept recommending winter coats in Sahara - daft as a brush!
Our school band called themselves Daft Punk but could only play chopsticks.

examples.sentence: The museum displayed a jade dagger from the Shang Dynasty.
He carved the turkey with a dagger-shaped knife at the BBQ party.
In the Peking opera, the actor daggered the air with dramatic movements.
The knight daggered the apple on the dummy's head with precision.
The two e-sports teams were at daggers drawn before the finals.
My mom looked daggers at me when I spilled milk tea on her new qipao.

examples.sentence: The dahlia in her balcony blossoms like fireworks in August.
We decorated the wedding venue with Mexican dahlias and peonies.
My daily routine includes checking Weibo 50 times.
The daily vitamin intake is written on the milk tea cup.
Wearing pajamas became her daily attire during lockdown.
These daily necessities can all be bought on Pinduoduo.
The panda cub is weighed daily like a VIP in the zoo.
You should practice English daily as eating hotpot.
People's Daily explains policies with emojis sometimes.
I read the campus daily for canteen discount information.
TikTok has become part of Chinese daily life.
The milk tea shop's daily special is always sold out by noon.
The Peking opera performer moved daintily across the stage like floating clouds.
She picked up the teacup daintily with her little finger extended.
The mooncakes were daintily decorated with edible gold leaf.
The hotpot ingredients were arranged daintily in lotus-shaped plates.
The imperial chef daintily selected only the uncurled tea leaves.
She dressed daintily in qipao for the Spring Festival dinner.
The food blogger eats daintily even when devouring spicy crayfish.

examples.sentence: The dainty porcelain teacups resembled blooming cherry blossoms.
Her dainty handwriting looked like dancing fireflies on the paper.
The dainty mooncakes with lotus paste melted in my mouth.
Grandma's dainty osmanthus cakes always disappear within minutes.
The dainty old gentleman insists on using ivory chopsticks.
Her dainty tea ceremony involves 18 precise steps.
The dainty panda refuses to eat bamboo stalks with blemishes.
My dainty cat turns her nose up at any fish below Â¥100/kg.
The dainty eater pushed away the durian like it was nuclear waste.
The Peking opera performer moved with dainty steps on bound feet.
Mengniu Dairy sponsors many sports events in China.
The dairy recalled contaminated milk powder last week.
I buy yogurt from the 24-hour dairy near my compound.
This century-old dairy still uses glass milk bottles.
Robots milk cows in modern dairies in Inner Mongolia.
The dairy covers an area equivalent to 200 football fields.
Lactose intolerance people should avoid dairy products.
Holsteins are the most common dairy cattle worldwide.
Inner Mongolia thrives on dairying, producing 20% of China's milk.
Modern dairying uses robots to milk cows at 4am.
Organic dairying forbids growth hormones in cows.
The dairyman gets up at 4am to milk the cows.
As a dairyman, his hands always smell like fresh milk.
The dairyman delivers organic yogurt to our neighborhood every Thursday.
My grandfather was a dairyman who sold cheese at the farmer's market.
The dairyman invested in robotic milking machines last year.
As the dairyman of this ranch, he oversees 200 Holstein cows.
The emperor's golden dais was decorated with dragon carvings.
Singers stood on the wedding dais to perform.
The TED speaker nervously tapped the dais with his notes.
Ancient teachers would throw chalk at students from the dais.
When the mayor mounted the dais, all cameras focused on him.
She wore a daisy chain crown at the music festival.
The field was dotted with daisies like spilled milk.
That programmer is a real daisy in the tech industry.
The rookie turned out to be a daisy on the basketball court.
We stayed at a daisy hotel during the business trip.
His daisy performance earned a standing ovation.
After 3 cups of coffee, I'm fresh as a daisy for the meeting.
If I keep working overtime, I'll be pushing up daisies soon.

examples.sentence: The farmer grows dal alongside turmeric in his field.
Dal trees provide shade for tea plantations in southern India.
My Bengali roommate cooks dal with coconut milk every Thursday.
The secret to perfect dal lies in the timing of adding ghee.
This Mumbai street vendor's dal makes foreigners cry happy tears.
We ordered three types of dal and 16 naans for the office party.
The dal tadka here comes with free refills like bubble tea shops.
Indian students abroad often crave simple dal chawal.
The Yorkshire Dales are famous for their cheese-making traditions.
We picnicked in a dale surrounded by wildflowers.
Morning mist often lingers in the dale where the stream flows.
Hikers love this dale for its crystal-clear brook.

examples.sentence: The CEO's dalliance with his assistant caused a workplace scandal.
Ancient poets often wrote about dalliance under moonlit pavilions.
Their tea-house dalliance included feeding each other zongzi.
The tango originated from street dalliance in Argentina.
The panda dallied with its bamboo shoot like a TikTok influencer.
Lao Wang dallies with his mahjong tiles before playing the winning move.
College students dally at milk tea shops instead of attending lectures.
He dallied at the snack street until sunset.
Don't dally your youth on endless mobile games!
She dallied three hours deciding which hotpot base to choose.
She dallies over her makeup like streaming a live show.
He dallied away his annual leave watching idol dramas.
The fire station's dalmatian mascot has perfect polka-dot symmetry.
Cruella de Vil wanted to make a fur coat from 101 dalmatians.
Her dalmatian puppy looks like a moving ink painting.
The Three Gorges Dam generates enough electricity to power 10 Shanghai cities.
Beavers build natural dams with branches and mud.
His arrogance became a dam to career advancement.
Language barrier is the biggest dam in international relationships.
She dammed her tears during the farewell speech.
The government is trying to dam the flow of misinformation.
Ancient Egyptians dammed the Nile to store water.
The villagers dammed the stream to create a fishing pond.
He dammed up his anger during the negotiation.
The hailstorm caused serious damage to lychee crops in Guangdong.
Drinking bubble tea daily does permanent damage to your wallet.
The scandal did irreparable damage to the celebrity's reputation.
No physical damage was found after the panda rolled down the hill.
Scammers damaged over 10,000 shared bikes with fake QR codes.
Eating hotpot while watching dramas damages both chopsticks and plot comprehension.
TikTok challenge videos sometimes make me suspect I have brain damage.
The PR team worked overnight for damage control after the live-streaming accident.
The damaged iPhone still had 1% battery to send a final SOS message.
Her damaged umbrella turned into a modern art installation in the wind.
The damaging comments on Weibo triggered hot discussion.
Typhoon Doksuri left damaging trails in Fujian province.
Eating stinky tofu daily can be damaging to relationships.
The damaging evidence made the influencer lose 1M followers overnight.
Bubble tea straws are considered environmentally damaging.
The Ming Dynasty collector cherished a piece of Persian damask with peony patterns.
Her qipao was made from silk damask that shimmered like moonlight.
The sunset painted the Forbidden City in delicate damask.
She blushed to the shade of damask rose when receiving flowers.
The damask tablecloth became the star of the Mid-Autumn banquet.
His damask waistcoat featured intricate carp motifs.
The damask clouds over West Lake inspired countless poets.
Her damask lipstick matched the autumn maple leaves perfectly.
The master craftsman damasked the fabric with a flying phoenix design.
This Jacquard loom can damask 16 types of cloud patterns.
The new apprentice is learning to damask on traditional looms.
These silkworms' cocoons will eventually damask into brocade.
The perfume was distilled from authentic damask roses.
The legendary sword was forged from damask steel with visible wave patterns.
The dame entered the teahouse with a jade hairpin.
Dame Judi Dench played M in James Bond films.

examples.sentence: Dammit! I forgot to mute my mic before singing in the online meeting.
Dammit, the delivery guy put my bubble tea upside down again!
Dammit, this spicy hotpot burned my tongue but I can't stop eating!
Dammit, my pet corgi ate my final thesis draft.
Goddammit! My phone autocorrected 'boss' to 'babe' in the work group chat.
I don't give a damn about his opinion on my new haircut.
Her excuse isn't worth a damn in this situation.
The witch put a damn on the village.
In some cultures, a damn is considered irreversible.
Damn! I forgot to bring my umbrella on a rainy day.
Damn, this spicy hotpot is burning my tongue!
The old man damned the thieves who stole his antique teapot.
In the movie, the priest damned the evil spirit.
The preacher said liars would be damned to hell.
Many religions believe sinners are damned for eternity.
The critic damned the new TV drama without watching it.
She's always damning modern fashion trends.
You damn well know I'm allergic to seafood!
Gen Z workers don't give a damn about office politics.

examples.sentence: The damnable WiFi made me miss the lottery deadline.
That damnable pop-up ad kept covering the subtitles.
This damnable humidity ruined my new perm.
The damnable alarm clock went off during my nap.
The villain laughed damnably while destroying the artwork.
He was damnably late for the blind date, ruining the first impression.
The chili oil was damnably spicy, making us cry instantly.
She sings damnably well, putting professional singers to shame.
The politician faced public damnation for his emoji-filled speech.
Ancient poets used damnation as a theme to warn against greed.
Medieval paintings often depicted the damnation of sinners.
In Journey to the West, monsters feared Sun Wukong's staff more than eternal damnation.
The witch's damnation made the crops wither instantly.
His damnation sounded like a TikTok remix with excessive autotune.
"Damnation! I forgot to save the 100-page thesis before the power outage!"
"Damnation! The AI detected my 5,000-word copy-pasted essay."
"Damnation! My baozi rolled under the high-speed train seat!"
Video game villains always threaten players with eternal damnation.
That damned mosquito bit me three times in a row!
The damned elevator broke down again during rush hour.
Where's that damned remote control? The football match is starting!
He forgot the damned passport on the day of his international flight.
The hotpot was damned spicy, but I couldn't stop eating it.
It's damned hard to find a parking space in this area after 6pm.

usages.form: damned if I do, damned if I don't

examples.sentence: If I work overtime I'm lazy, if I leave early I'm irresponsible - damned if I do, damned if I don't!

examples.sentence: The witch's damning echoed through the castle.
His letter ended with a poetic damning of corruption.
Dante described the damning souls in his Inferno.
The fresco showed angels judging the damning.
The whistleblower provided damning evidence.
Her tweet contained a damning prediction about the economy.
The damning speech went viral on TikTok.
He gave me a damning look when I took the last dumpling.
Saying 'your PPT is colorful' is damning with faint praise.
